traceability.evidence: In src/rules/valid-req-reference.ts the JSDoc @req tags reference REQ-DEEP-PARSE, REQ-DEEP-MATCH, REQ-DEEP-CACHE and REQ-DEEP-PATH, but the story (docs/stories/010.0-DEV-DEEP-VALIDATION.story.md) defines REQ-DEEP-PARSE, REQ-DEEP-MATCH, REQ-DEEP-FORMAT, REQ-DEEP-SECTION, REQ-DEEP-CACHE and REQ-DEEP-ERROR. The rule documentation (docs/rules/valid-req-reference.md) likewise only lists REQ-DEEP-PARSE, REQ-DEEP-MATCH and REQ-DEEP-PATH. There are no annotations or examples covering REQ-DEEP-FORMAT, REQ-DEEP-SECTION or REQ-DEEP-ERROR, and instead a non-spec requirement REQ-DEEP-PATH is present.
traceability.notes: While the core validation logic and tests for matching or missing requirement IDs pass, the implementation and rule documentation do not fully align with the storyâ€™s defined requirements. Several named requirements are unimplemented in traceability annotations and documentation, so the story is not yet fully satisfied.
